description: Proposed creation of nine self-contained flats (six studio flats and three one-bedroom flats), a communal lounge, a manager's office and a residents' gym on the first and second floors in place of the approved development of eight self-contained flats, together with alterations to planning permission 01143/78/P8 to allow retention of the elevations and footprint as built
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted therewith (Planning Statement by DLP; Design and Access Statement by DLP; Location and Block Plan; 013/PL04 Rev B; Received 02/12/2015; 013/PL02 Rev D; 013/PL03 Rev G; 013/PL05;  013/PL07 Rev A; received 23/03/2016; 013/PL01 Rev F; Received 20/04/2016.) and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.

Condition : 3 - The communal lounge in the garden, the communal lounge/gym on the first and second floor of the building hereby approved shall be used as shared spaces for the occupiers of the flats and shall not be used as primary residential accommodation (for example, kitchen, living room or sleeping accommodation), separate dwellings or separate gym.

Condition : 4 - The 'Warden's Maintenance Office' on the first floor of the building hereby approved shall be only used by warden/caretaker of the building and shall not be used as a separate unit of residential accommodation without further grant of planning permission.

Condition : 5 - The appearance and content (including species and specimen type) of the two planting beds proposed on the Sutton Way and Upper Sutton Lane forecourts shall be in accordance with the details approved under application reference 01143/78/P8(4) on 04/03/2013. The details so approved shall be implemented before the development is first occupied and shall be retained permanently thereafter.

Condition : 6 - The access doorway to the shop and other doorways used by the public shall have a minimum clear width of 900mm, a level surface or ramp between the pavement and the floor and a door handle of not more than 1m above ground level.
Condition : 7 - No deliveries to or collection from the shop hereby approved shall take place outside the hours of 08.00 - 19.00 hours Monday and not at any time Sunday, Bank or Public Holidays.

Condition : 8 - The loading bay on the Upper Sutton Lane forecourt shown on the approved drawing shall be retained during the lifetime of this development. The loading bay shall be kept clear during delivery and refuse collections times but otherwise may be used for parking of customer vehicles. Delivery vehicles shall only enter and leave the site via the Upper Sutton Lane.
Condition : 9 - The use hereby permitted shall not be open to customers outside the following times 06.00 - 23.00 Monday to Sunday.
Condition : 10 - The noise from the plant shall not exceed the levels stated in the Plan Noise Assessment received with the planning application 01143/78/P11 on 03/12/2014.

Condition : 11 - The fencing around the plant area shall be a close-boarded wooden fence no more than two metres in height and not less than 1.7m high and shall not be replaced or repaired otherwise than with the same.

Condition : 12 - Prior to first occupation of the residential units hereby approved full details of the cycle parking in line with London Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details shall be implemented prior to first occupation of the site and shall thereafter be retained as such.

Condition : 13 - Before the residential flats hereby approved are occupied, the details of how the car park operates and how the car parking spaces will be divided between retail and residential uses shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The parking provision for the retail unit should meet London Plan parking standards. In order to comply with policy and what has been agreed, the residents' parking bays shall be provided with appropriate "residents only" signage and provided with lockable drop-down bollards to prevent retail customers from parking in them. The development shall only be carried out and completed in accordance with that approved scheme and shall be permanent retained as such thereafter.

Condition : 14 - The vehicle access from the site to Sutton Way shall be used for exit only and physical measures and signage shall be erected within three month of this decision if not already in place to ensure that this is the case. The measures so installed shall be retained permanently.

Condition : 15 - When each flat is occupied for the first time residents shall be provided a welcome pack, detailing sustainable transport opportunities in the area including a local public transport guide; cycle maps; and information about walking & cycling in Hounslow, including cycle training. A copy shall be submitted to the Council for its records when it is first issued.

Condition : 16 - The energy efficiency and sustainable measures approved under application 01143/78/P9 shall be installed before first occupation of the development and thereafter retained permanently. The evidence (e.g. photographs and copies of installation contracts) shall also be submitted to the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that the development has been carried out in accordance with the approved details before first occupation of the dwellings.
Condition : 17 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the sustainable construction statement approved under application reference 01143/78/P8(22,23) on 23/07/2013.
Condition : 18 - The Sustainable Drainage Scheme shall be installed in accordance with the details approved under application reference 01143/78/P8(22,23) on 23/07/2013.

Condition : 19 - The windows at first and second floor level in the south west elevation, (except for the 1st, 2nd and 4th windows - from the left - all windows on the first floor -, except for the 1st and 2nd windows - from the left - all windows on second floor) shall be obscured and fixed; and in the southeast elevation, second windows on the left on first and second floor levels shall be obscured and fixed to a level no lower than 1.7 metres above the adjacent internal floor area.

Condition : 20 - An area either side of the two vehicle accesses not less than 2.4metres deep and 2.4metres wide shall be kept permanently clear of any obstruction to visibility greater than 600mm in height above ground.

Condition : 21 - Notwithstanding the approved drawings, prior to occupation of the flats full details of works to the highways shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority, to include:
"	widening of the access onto Sutton Way to 4.5m
"	resurfacing of the crossover on Upper Sutton Lane to provide clear delineation of the back edge of footway and formal dropped kerbs at either end
These details shall be carried out to the satisfaction of the local planning authority and be completed no later than 3 months after the first occupation of any flat.

Condition : 22 - Within 3 months of the date of this consent, a Delivery and Servicing Plan (including details of vehicle access and egress arrangements and timing that servicing shall take place) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details shall accord with current guidance such as that issued by TfL and include measures required to ensure sufficient arrangements - physical as well as managerial - for the servicing, including refuse collection, of all aspects of the development, the timing of hours for deliveries by motor vehicles and a timetable for implementation.  The Plan shall be carried out as approved. The measures shall be implemented as approved and shall be so maintained for the life of the development.
